abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio and City Council reach handshake deal on $82.1 billion budget that adds new spending for range of initiatives, including summer jobs for youths, after-school programs, libraries, domestic violence programs and reserve funds; budget contains no job or staff cuts, and increases city spending by approximately 4 percent over previous year's level.
lead_paragraph: The deal adds tens of million in new spending, including for a summer jobs program for youths and more money for the district attorneys’ offices in the five boroughs.

headline.main: De Blasio and City Council Agree on $82.1 Billion Budget

snippet: The deal adds tens of million in new spending, including for a summer jobs program for youths and more money for the district attorneys’ offices in the five boroughs.
